title: Partial
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 16.9 is found at Fruits Apples and the minimum is found at Pineapples where Per capita consumption in pounds is 7.8.
Fruits Pineapples has 2.17 times less Per capita consumption in pounds than Fruits Apples which is the highest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
Fruits Apples has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds and Pineapples has the lowest Per capita consumption in pounds.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Fruits, and Per capita consumption in pounds in each Fruits on the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 16.9 is found at Fruits Apples and the minimum is found at Pineapples where Per capita consumption in pounds is 7.8.
Fruits Pineapples has 2.17 times less Per capita consumption in pounds than Fruits Apples which is the highest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 5 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is highest at Fruits Apples and lowest at Fruits Pineapples.
Fruits Oranges has the second highest value for Per capita consumption in pounds.
There is a difference of 9.1 between the maximum Fruits Apples and minimum Fruits Pineapples.
Fruits Apples is higher than any other Fruitss with value 16.9, followed by Oranges, and Grapes. Down to Fruits Pineapples with the lowest value 7.8.
The Fruits Apples has 1.72 times more Per capita consumption in pounds than average.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is 49.0 if we add up values of all Fruitss.
